title.rendered: World Smile Day celebrated at Mission Education centres

content.rendered:
Smile Foundation’s initiative “World Smile Day” was celebrated by children from our Mission Education centres in Delhi. The World Smile Day signifies the importance of “smile” as the universal sign of hope and happiness. As Mother Teresa has said, “We shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do”, just sharing our smile with someone in need is a simple, but valuable gesture of empathy and kindness. By sensitizing children to the significance of the positive values one can derive from a smile, we hope to imbibe in them these lifelong values from an early age. Furthermore, these children are the carriers of change among their families and communities and will spread the message further and farther.

Smile Foundation intends to take “World Smile Day” to an even larger scale by making it a national celebration of essential human values and bring together thousands of children and masses, so that empathy and kindness can become the strongholds of our society.
